poem:
"An Unruly Dance of Power"

In the crude garden of impassioned wills,
Trump, a discordant crow, seeks dismissals.
The soil of law muddied by his rumbling roars,
Yet Willis, a rose, stands against fraudulent roars.
Battle lines drawn in Georgia's bloody earth,
Each day, democracy's shifting girth.
In the arena of justice, chaos unfurls;
Such is the dance, our mad, mad world.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump seeks to disqualify Fani Willis from prosecuting him in Georgia Donald Trump joined a motion on Thursday seeking to disqualify the Fulton county district attorney prosecuting him over efforts to overturn the 2020 election in Georgia after her recent remarks decrying an alleged affair with one of her deputies. The filing, submitted to Fulton county superior judge Scott McAfee on Thursday, adopted and added to an earlier motion to have the district attorney Fani". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
